CHAT.comment: Home Visit 4; on couch Chi leaning back; Mot holds one side of book and looks over Chi's shoulder; Mot helps turn pages
Book Reading; The Very Hungry Caterpillar

Chi and Mot sit on the couch. Chi leans back and Mot holds one side of the book , helps turn the pages and looks over Chi's shoulder. Chi leaves out words as he reads , but is reasonably fluent , indicating that he is not only relying on text (as Mot suggests at the beginning that he might read by memory). he stumbles over some words (especially at the end when he's getting tired) , and Mot helps by repeating the word before , by getting him to sound the problem word out , or by providing the word. Once after Mot provides a word , Chi whines <don't tell> and Mot says <but I want to help you>. Chi swallows the ends of words and phrases so that some hungry refrains can barely be heard.

u.a: Chi fades out at the end of phrases and sentences; you can barely hear the word hungry in this sentence
looks up and smiles at EXP
some sort of negotiation about turning pages , perhaps
points at each word in text while reading
rolls eyes , getting tired of reading
closes book a little so that Mot can't see very well
a male voice , not sure if it was EXP
